content.description: Same start as False Alarm, but continues straight up instead of joining Hanging by a Thread.  The top section is much more sustained than on False Alarm.
content.location: same start as False Alarm.  just left of Hanging by a Thread, and right of Nostalgia

content.description: Starts the same as leviathan, but goes left through the small roof.  The crux is working through the roof and moving past the next set of jugs.  The top is steep climbing on better holds.
content.location: starts the same as leviathan, two routes right of Hanging by a Thread.

content.description: Climbs a slab to an obvious sharp arete on the far right side of the roof area.  The first crux is getting off the slab and established on the arete.  The climbing eases significantly but remains pumpy until two bolts below the anchors.  A final 12a challenge guards the anchors.
content.location: Right most route in the roof area.  Obvious sharp arete

content.description:
This is a great extension to

Nostalgia

(5.11c) and it's a rope stretcher. The crux comes at about bolt 16 or 17 with pretty small crimps that lead up to a juggy finish - just look for all of the glued feet and crimps.

Since this route is over 100' long it's common to L-P-L to get down - lower down to the midpoint anchors, pull your rope, and then lower again/rap to the ground (works with a 60m rope).

A slightly dirty, seldom climbed line of flakes and mini dihedrals capped with small roofs. Crux at the last bolt. Beware of the dirty pillar on the right at the crux, it is big (4x2x1), loose, and will kill anyone standing at the base/belaying if (when) it comes off. This needs to be trundled, the sooner the better.
content.location:
Starts just right of

Hanging by a Thread

.

content.description: A bouldery sequence over a bulge starts things off and leads to a funky middle section on big but pumping holds as you work up and left slightly. It finishes on a section of interesting off-vertical face to anchors at the base of a slabby section of rock.
content.location:
Located right of center under the massive roof between

Epiphany

on the left and

Catch 22

on the right.

content.description:
A hard stand up move at the 2nd bolt starts off the tricky opening section. Crimpy moves and reaches make this a sustained climb. All the moves seem easier than the nearby Culture Shock but it may be a more challenging experience overall. Fun climbing throughout.

The extension, called

Swank Nostalgia

(5.12a), follows 10 more bolts over multiple bulges and checks in at 12a.
content.location:
This is at the far left side of the large roof and just left of

Hanging by a Thread

.

content.description: Very pumpy and popular, one of the crags greatest classics.
content.protection: 13 bolts to 2 cold shuts, use a long draw or skip the 3rd bolt to eliminate rope drag
content.location: When facing the roof, Leviathan ends just under the roof, where it gets smaller to the left.

content.description: A few funny moves off the ground lead to the crux above the 3rd bolt. Some easier ground leads to a long move and more fun climbing. A final crux at an undercling leads to a short crack and the anchors.
content.location:
Down in the pit below the roof. Left of

Leviathan

.

content.description: five bolts of relatively easy climbing leads to the first difficult section at an obvious bulge.  Negotiate several moves on very small crimps (12a/b), and the climbing will ease up again for a few bolts.  Clip the last bolt and the strenuous undercling crux guards the anchors.
content.location: This route has the same start as Angst, but continues straight up the wall after the fourth bolt.  located to the left of balrog and right of Vendetta.

content.description: This is the left start to Hanging by a Thread.  Climb six bolts of cruxy and bouldery moves before joining Hanging by a Thread.  The most difficult moves are moving past the 3rd bolt, and clipping the fourth.
content.location: Starts about 10 feet left of Hanging by a Thread, and 10 feet right of Nostalgia on the left end of the roof area

content.description:
Climb the vertical, slighty chossy, arete left of

Salutations

with some powerful moves and then move right after the 8th bolt to finish up the interesting slab moves of

Salutations

.

Good movement on this one but a bit more traffic is needed to clean it up and gain another star. Worth doing if in the area or wanting a quick tick after doing Salutations.
content.location:
Beneath the roof between

Delirious

and

Salutations

.

content.description:
This newer addition to the

Roof Area

has cleaned up nicely and offers continuous movement without any stopper moves making it a good choice for those breaking into the grade or running laps.

Climb a short flared corner to a ledge and then over a bulge on mostly good holds to another ledge. Stem and lieback your way up a flared corner to a crux sequence pulling another bulge. Once past the crux vertical face on large holds gains the anchors.
content.location:
Right of center in the Roof Area midway between

Balrog

on the left and

Epiphany

on the right.

content.description: Link up starting on Catch 22. Clip 5th Bolt  then head left to finish up Salutations on the 7th bolt. There is one independent bolt protecting the link up.
content.location: Starts left of American Dream P1, on Catch 22.

content.description: Crux starts at the 3rd bolt and continues until after the first small bulge.  The top is significantly easier (5.10)
content.location: located right of Leviathan and left of Vendetta

content.description: Three bolts of easy (5.9) climbing lead to a more strenous middle section on smaller (hard to see) holds.  The crux starts just below the large bulge, and is very bouldery.  The last move of the crux is a long throw to a very small two or three finger crimp.  The top of the route is insecure slab with holds that are hard to see.
content.location:
This route is at the far right end of the roof.  Three routes right of

Delirious

.

content.description:
Fun 5.11- climbing leads to a high crux. A series of bad holds after a powerful clip yield access to the headwall. Commit to the bad holds and you are quickly rewarded with an easy finish.

This route only lacks in stars due the variance in difficulty between the crux and the rest of the climb
content.location:
Below the right side of the big roof. Left of Salutations and

Delirious

.

content.description: One of the few Multi pitch routes at the quarry. Pitch 1 goes at .11b. Pitch 2 is some really awesome 5.10a low angle slab lybacking. Pitch 3 is an 7 bolt traverse under the roof to anchor number 3.Pitch 4 is .11c to shuts. Stellar climbing on small holds and beautiful exposure.
content.location: Just right of Catch 22. Roof area

content.description: The business of the climb is in the first 5 bolts.  The crux comes at an obvious bulge early on.  After clipping the 5th bolt, the climb gets quite easy (10a) to the top.
content.location: Route is located to the right of Critical Mass, two right of Leviathan, and just left of Angst.
